Notes: The Hungarian government has in place an existing job seeker allowance. A benefit that replaces 60% of gross wages with the current minimum wage ceiling (minimum wage was EUR 487/month in January 2020), which is paid to the unemployed for three months instead of the previous nine months. Anyone who is still unemployed after three months must register for public work. If not, then they will be without any allowances. If they are still unemployed, then they must accept the work the state offers them. In recent weeks, the gov has loosened restrictions on this program to remove some of the paperwork, but net new income support policies have not been put in place. https://web.archive.org/web/20200507040409/https://hungarytoday.hu/number-of-unemployed-rising-govt-promises-jobs-in-3-months/ In fact, Prime Minister Orban seems opposed to such policies: https://web.archive.org/web/20200507040656/https://euobserver.com/opinion/148201

Under this scheme, the Hungarian State undertakes to subsidise 70% of employees’ unpaid salary (subject to certain conditions) for three months provided the employer employs the employees in reduced working time instead of making them redundant, and agrees to maintain the employment of the subsidized employee for a certain period. Employers can apply for the State subsidy from 16 April 2020, and the new rules apply retroactively for the current procedures in place.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200720075338/https://www.twobirds.com/en/news/articles/2020/hungary/covid-19-the-much-awaited-new-rules-of-hungarian-short-time-working-and-the-state-subsidy-scheme    Further, there are certain conditions the employers need to satisfy to be eligible for the scheme, which suggests that all the workers may not be eligible. The employer should:  - have been operating for at least 6 months,  - demonstrate that the reason behind the employment in reduced working time is directly and closely linked to the emergency situation, and provide credible evidence that the maintenance of headcount is essential to its continuous economic activity and thus of national economic interest,  - present the measures taken and expected so far to overcome the economic difficulties,  - demonstrate that, in respect of the above point, the employer has exhausted all the available opportunities to reschedule the working time, - fulfill the criteria of sound labor relations, no ongoing liquidation proceedings against the employer (e.g. voluntary liquidation, liquidation, bankruptcy proceedings),  - as of 31 December 2019, the employer was not classified as a company in difficulty.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200720075353/https://www2.deloitte.com/hu/en/pages/tax/articles/new-wage-subsidy-scheme-to-maintain-jobs.html    These rules suggest that these measures are not designed to cover all workers, especially those in the informal sector who are quite likely to find it difficult to adequately prove their eligibility.  Hence, listing it as 2F.

In an interview given to public radio MR1, Hungarian State Secretary for Public Education Zoltan Maruzsa said that the digital education introduced in mid-March due to the novel coronavirus epidemic would continue until the summer break. "However, the rigid ban which was introduced on March 14 will lift on June 2 so that where needed, small group or even individual consultations, or sessions for catching up will be permitted," the State Secretary said. "Teachers and heads of institutions should consult with parents," Maruzsa added. He underlined that children will not be required to attend school, but cautioned that the opening could help a lot for those who for some reasons could not get into digital education.    https://web.archive.org/save/http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2020-05/22/c_139076476.htm

From 28 May, open-air cultural and sporting events (e.g. open-air theater, cinema, circus, exhibition, literary event) can be attended in accordance with epidemiological rules. Spectators may occupy only one in four seats, shall not sit directly behind each other and shall have a safety distance of at least 1.5 meters between them. An outdoor event is a program that takes place for the entire duration outside a walled, covered building on all sides, or during which spectators are protected by a tent (such as a circus tent) due to the weather, or those that are enclosed by a wall built for the event or take place in an uncovered or partially covered facility (e.g. stadium, swimming pool, outdoor stage, outdoor cinema).  Worship services can be held, and civil marriages and funerals can also be held at a protective distance. Family events and weddings of less than 200 people can be held in the countryside from June 1, in Budapest from June 15, 2020.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200702121744/https://hu.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

Prime Minister of Hungary, Viktor Orbán, said on 21 August that, 'travel restrictions based on the classification of countries according to the prevalence of Covid-19 that the government introduced in the summer would no longer be sufficient from Sept. 1, adding that restrictions on foreign travel would have to be tightened'.    https://archive.vn/rnPjy

Seems the Hungarian government is determined to let most schools and universities to open as usual, though it is unclear how much teaching activities are conducted online.  https://archive.vn/trnRQ    However, 'according to Péter Horváth, President of the National Teachers’ Chamber, schools will be in trouble after the start of September if they want to comply with the protocol in all respects.'  https://archive.vn/51Rhv    The Faculty of Science of the Eötvös Loránd University has banned personal attendance of all lectures and seminars for students from 31 August.  https://archive.vn/h6AxQ

The Minister heading the Prime Minister’s Office of Hungary, Gergely Gulyás, announced on 31 August that Hungary would 'reclose its borders for internationals starting from Tuesday, September 1, after a spike in the number of COVID-19 infections abroad... The corridor to transit through the country will continue to be functional ... there would be some exemptions in the reintroduced ban, such as for diplomatic visits and other emergency cases. Nationals of Hungary [and citizens of other countries with permanent residence in Hungary, or a valid residence permit for at least 90 days] returning from foreign countries must undergo quarantine or present negative PCR test results upon their arrival. The entry ban will remain effective for at least one month.'    https://archive.vn/Kud3u  https://archive.vn/2XpbC

The new school year starts in one week, which the government is planning to conduct with regular classroom teaching for the time being – digital education is not yet seen as justified.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201122181532/https://hungarytoday.hu/coronavirus-hungary-schools-epidemiological-protocols/

Hungary has closed its borders since 1 September 'to all foreigners - with a few exceptions for military convoys humanitarian transit, business or diplomatic travel, as well as travelers from Poland, the Czech Republic and Slovakia. Additionally, Hungarian citizens returning from abroad will have to self-quarantine for two weeks, or until they provide authorities with two negative test results - whose cost will be at their own expense for non-essential travelling.'    https://archive.vn/B7T55

'Beginning on 7 September, Hungary has ordered a ban on leaving and visiting all social institutions that provide specialised care, based on a decree issued by the National Chief Medical Officer. Exemption from the visiting ban may only be provided if someone would like to visit a relative who is in the final stage of a terminal illness. The ban on leaving institutions is not applicable to night shelters and temporary accommodation for the homeless.'    https://archive.vn/nDmgU

Hungary aims to advance its testing policies:  Hungary plans to launch rapid antigen tests for coronavirus infections possibly as soon as Tuesday, Prime Minister Viktor Orban said on Monday, as testing in the central European country has struggled to keep up with the pace of infections.    Antigen tests detects proteins on the surface of the virus. They require an uncomfortable nasal or throat swab, and can produce results more quickly than PCR tests - which detect genetic material in the virus - but are considered less accurate.  https://www.reuters.com/article/idUSKBN2742DJ

On 9th November 2020, The Prime Minister announced that the government will ask the Hungarian Parliament to grant another 90 days of extraordinary powers, and Hungary plans to introduce the some measures to take effect at midnight on November 11. This will include a requirement for high schools and universities to switch to e-learning.  Digital curriculum will be reintroduced above the 8th grade in high schools (for kids, typically, 14 years old and over). A curfew is in effect between 8am and 5pm. Everyone must be home by 8pm.  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201130162224/https://koronavirus.gov.hu/aktualis
No restrictions on intercity or interstate travel.  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201130162450/https://hu.usembassy.gov/covid-19/
Foreigners without a residence permit are banned from visiting Hungary as of September 1.  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201130162450/https://hu.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

The state will reimburse hotels for 80 percent of the bookings registered before November 8.  Restaurants and leisure facilities will be exempt from paying contributions after their employees for the next 30 days and the government will take over half of their employees’ wage costs. Employers are only eligible for those allowances, however, if they commit to keeping and paying their employees.  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201130162602/http://abouthungary.hu/news-in-brief/hungarian-government-to-reimburse-catering-and-hospitality-sector-for-lost-covid-revenue/
The credit moratorium on households has been extended to June 30, 2021  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201130162224/https://koronavirus.gov.hu/aktualis

PCR tests are available for anyone with suspected coronavirus. Mobile testing stations are also in operation.  Tests are available generally, but must be paid for if the person isn't a suspected case.  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201130162224/https://koronavirus.gov.hu/aktualis

Chair of Hungarian Chamber of Doctors said on October 29th that current contact tracing efforts are insufficient to monitor the spread of the epidemic. Mask wearing is mandatory in shops, public transport, shopping malls, health and social care establishments, reception centres. As of 11 November, in settlements with more than 10,000 inhabitants masks will be compulsory in certain public areas designated by the mayor.  Masks are not mandatory while playing sports or in parks and green spaces.  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201130162224/https://koronavirus.gov.hu/aktualis

On December 7th, the Prime Minister stressed that the curfew between 8pm and 5am will be extended until January 11th, 2021.     Although there might be an exception for Christmas Eve (which will be announced by December 21), there will not be an exception for December 31st, meaning that New Year’s Eve parties and street balls cannot be held this year.    https://archive.vn/EsTSr

The Hungarian government will extend the 50 percent wage subsidy in tourism and hospitality sectors until the end of January 2021, protecting 40,000 jobs with wage subsidies.     https://archive.vn/vo5LN

The Hungarian government has started a COVID-19 vaccine registration at vakcinainfo.gov.hu in order to estimate how many people are interested in the vaccine. Although a vaccine is still not available, the Russian vaccine and its documentation are being examined, and the documentation of the Chinese vaccine will soon arrive in Hungary.     https://archive.vn/y5lyf

On 18 December, it was announced that vaccinations against the coronavirus can begin on 27 or 28 December, in the first round a sufficient amount will arrive in Hungary for 35,000 people, and health workers will be vaccinated in the first place, Prime Minister Viktor Orban announced on Kossuth radio's Good Morning, Hungary! on his show. Vaccination will be voluntary and free of charge.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201219205730/https://koronavirus.gov.hu/cikkek/orban-december-27-28-kezdodhetnek-az-elso-oltasok

On December 19, economic protections are extended until 01 July.  According to this, the moratorium on loan repayments for families and businesses will be extended unchanged for six months until 1 July. The moratorium will be automatically extended, only those who want to repay their loan despite the moratorium will have to visit their bank, the Prime Minister said.  It also announced that businesses forced to close temporarily as a a cause of disease measures would be supported by the government in December and January by waived and taking over two-thirds of wage costs. In addition to catering, hotels and tourism, the remission of contributions and wage subsidies will be extended to private bus companies that are forced to take a break.  Viktor Orban also said that business taxes for small and medium-sized enterprises and sole proprietors will be cut by half from 1 January. These businesses account for the most jobs and are the most vulnerable during the epidemic, he justified the measure, adding that municipalities of less than 25,000 inhabitants will receive support from the government and the financial situation of larger municipalities will be reviewed individually.  The fourth decision is to help families with children and children with a reduced home improvement loan of up to HUF 6 million with a maximum interest rate of 3 percent. Of this, HUF 3 million is a non-refundable grant, which can be used at the end of the renovation and automatically reduces the amount of the loan, the Prime Minister explained.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201219210422/https://koronavirus.gov.hu/cikkek/orban-viktor-kormany-gazdasagvedelmi-akcioterv-kiegesziteserol-rendelkezett

All shops and services, with the exception of pharmacies and petrol stations, must close at 7 p.m.  According to US Embassy in Hungary, restaurants, cafés, bars, and clubs are closed, only take-out/ delivery service is permitted; leisure facilities will be closed, including museums, theatres, gyms, swimming pools, cinemas and zoos.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210207165432/http://abouthungary.hu/news-in-brief/coronavirus-heres-the-latest/  http://web.archive.org/web/20210207163443/https://hu.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

General rule is that physical distancing of one and a half meters is to be kept, and face masks – only medical and textile masks that cover the nose and mouth are accepted – are mandatory when shopping, on public transport, in taxis, at public transport stations, waiting rooms and stops, in hospitals, social institutions, doctors’ offices, in shopping malls, and also in public spaces in municipalities with over 10,000 inhabitants. In the latter case, the government has authorized mayors to determine in which public spaces it is mandatory to wear a mask. The regulation applies to everybody, with the exception of children under six.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210208204058/https://hu.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

Current restrictions remain in place until 01 March. The Hungarian Police will enforce these restrictions by imposing fines and closing up places that violate the special rules:  Curfew between 8:00 p.m. and 5 a.m.  Private and family events may not exceed a group size limit of 10 people, not counting those below 14 years of age.  The government has extended the state of epidemiological preparedness for six months.  Ban on visitation in hospitals and elderly homes.  Social workers, healthcare professionals, doctors, nurses, as well as police and military officers working in the defense against the coronavirus may use public transport for free.  All shops and services, with the exception of pharmacies and petrol stations, must close at 7 p.m.  Mask-wearing is mandatory in public spaces of all settlements with a population above 10,000.  All forms of assembly are forbidden.  Free public parking.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210220193157/http://abouthungary.hu/news-in-brief/coronavirus-heres-the-latest/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210220201149/https://koronavirus.gov.hu/cikkek/az-orszaggyules-elott-veszelyhelyzeti-intezkedesek-meghosszabbitasa  https://web.archive.org/web/20210220193038/https://hu.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

From 08 March to 22 March, additional restrictions are in place and include the closure of shops and services. Kindergartens and primary schools will be closed until 7 April.    - Kindergartens and primary schools are not allowed to open until the end of spring break, and the content of digital education is determined by the ministers concerned. Digital education in secondary schools and higher education will continue.    The Ministry said there would be an extraordinary break in kindergartens, with the first working day after that on April 7. Education in schools will take place on a digital work schedule outside the classroom until 31 March, with the first day of school after the spring break there after 7 April. All public education institutions have been informed of the measures.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210314200716/https://koronavirus.gov.hu/cikkek/emmi-hetfotol-hatalyosak-az-uj-intezkedesek-koznevelesi-intezmenyekben  https://web.archive.org/web/20210314200812/https://koronavirus.gov.hu/cikkek/ket-het-szigoritasrol-dontott-kormany-abban-remenyben-hogy-husvetkor-ujra-tudjuk-inditani-az  https://web.archive.org/web/20210314195209/https://koronavirus.gov.hu/cikkek/kormanyinfo-szigoritasokrol-dontott-kormany  https://web.archive.org/web/20210314193404/https://hu.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

From 08 March to 22 March, additional restrictions are in place and include the closure of shops and services. Kindergartens and primary schools will be closed until 7 April.    - Shops must be closed. Exception: grocery stores, pharmacies, petrol stations, drugstores, tobacco shops, shops selling materials and equipment essential for economic, agricultural and forestry activities, as well as pet food and feed shops, the market and the farmers' market.  - All services are suspended, except for private health, social, financial, postal and vehicle service services. In view of Women's Day, flower shops can remain open on Monday 8 March, but then they have to close.  - Restaurants will still be able to buy takeaways.  - Kindergartens and primary schools are not allowed to open until the end of spring break, and the content of digital education is determined by the ministers concerned. Digital education in secondary schools and higher education will continue.  - Given the low infection rates, daycares do not close.  - The evening curfew will remain in effect.  - Masking is mandatory on all streets and public areas within the populated area.  - If possible, keep a protective distance of at least 1.5 metres from the other person.  - Work is possible, but we recommend working from home where possible. In the administration, work at home may be ordered, except in the case of those involved in the defence.  - Outdoor sports activities are possible, where a distance of 1.5 meters can be maintained. Training of certified athletes is permitted, matches are only possible behind closed gates.  - Parks, arboretums and forests remain open.  - We're tightening up border crossings, but we're not restricting transit and freight traffic.  - We are extending wage subsidies and tax breaks to sectors that need to close.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210314200812/https://koronavirus.gov.hu/cikkek/ket-het-szigoritasrol-dontott-kormany-abban-remenyben-hogy-husvetkor-ujra-tudjuk-inditani-az  https://web.archive.org/web/20210314195209/https://koronavirus.gov.hu/cikkek/kormanyinfo-szigoritasokrol-dontott-kormany  https://web.archive.org/web/20210314193404/https://hu.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

In view of Women's Day, flower shops can remain open on Monday 8 March, but then they have to close.  - Restaurants will still be able to buy takeaways.  - Kindergartens and primary schools are not allowed to open until the end of spring break, and the content of digital education is determined by the ministers concerned. Digital education in secondary schools and higher education will continue.  - Given the low infection rates, daycares do not close.  - The evening curfew will remain in effect.  - Masking is mandatory on all streets and public areas within the populated area.  - If possible, keep a protective distance of at least 1.5 metres from the other person.  - Work is possible, but we recommend working from home where possible. In the administration, work at home may be ordered, except in the case of those involved in the defence.  - Outdoor sports activities are possible, where a distance of 1.5 meters can be maintained. Training of certified athletes is permitted, matches are only possible behind closed gates.  - Parks, arboretums and forests remain open.  - We're tightening up border crossings, but we're not restricting transit and freight traffic.  - We are extending wage subsidies and tax breaks to sectors that need to close.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210314200812/https://koronavirus.gov.hu/cikkek/ket-het-szigoritasrol-dontott-kormany-abban-remenyben-hogy-husvetkor-ujra-tudjuk-inditani-az  https://web.archive.org/web/20210314195209/https://koronavirus.gov.hu/cikkek/kormanyinfo-szigoritasokrol-dontott-kormany  https://web.archive.org/web/20210314193404/https://hu.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

The report shows that the National Centre for Public Health spent HUF 35.1 billion mainly on the purchase of vaccines related to the coronavirus epidemic, the National Directorate-General for Hospitals spent HUF 24.0 billion primarily on the purchase of coronavirus and other medical supplies, and the National Blood Service spent HUF 9.1 billion on the procurement of tests for the coronavirus outbreak in the first two months of the year.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210327214033/https://koronavirus.gov.hu/cikkek/koltsegvetesi-kiadasok-jarvany-elleni-vedekezes-vakcinak-beszerzese-gazdasag-ujrainditasahoz    The health insurance and disease control fund earmarked for this year also represents a resource of HUF 3 trillion, which is open from above and can therefore be exceeded if necessary, they added. The government will continue to fully cover the costs of health protection against the epidemic, the PM said in his post.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210327214807/https://koronavirus.gov.hu/cikkek/pm-kormany-1127-milliard-forint-plusz-forrast-biztositott-az-egeszsegugynek

A graduate lifting of restrictions started on 7 April 2021 since the threshold of 2.5 million people vaccinated at least with the 1st dose was exceeded on 6 April 2021. The curfew begins later- at 10 p.m., opening hours of shops have been extended, and all services may open.  Measures in place:  - Curfew - 10 p.m. to 5 a.m, physical distancing of 1.5 m, face masks mandatory indoor and outdoor (in the inner city, on the street, and in public areas).   - Shops may be open from 5.30 a.m. until 9.30 p.m., with 10 square meters for 1 customer (with exceptions).   - All services may open, such as hairdressing salons, or beauty salons, and other services.  - Restaurants, cafés, bars, and clubs are closed. Only take-out and delivery service is permitted.   - Hotels can only receive guests travelling for business purposes, not for tourism.   - Leisure facilities are closed, including museums, theatres, gyms, swimming pools, cinemas and zoos.  - Kindergartens, primary, and secondary schools will be closed until April 19. Nurseries stay open.  - Visits to health care and social care institutions are banned.  - All gatherings are prohibited. Max. 10 people (not counting minors <14 years old) can attend a family gathering or a private event (50 people are allowed for a funeral).    https://archive.vn/Eyy2Y  https://archive.fo/buwxb

From May 1, shops may be open from 5.30 a.m. until 11 p.m. Shops have to set a limit of one customer per 10 square meters, except in the cases of children under the age of 14, people over the age of 65 and those assisting someone with a disability. Shops will have to ensure that those waiting to be let in can keep a safe distance of 1.5 meters from each other, with the exception of those living in the same household. Customers must also have access to hand sanitation, and shopping carts and trolleys must be disinfected on a regular basis. From April 7, all services may open, such as hairdressing salons, beauty salons, and other services. Restaurants, cafés, and bars can be open between 5 a.m. and 10.30 p.m. Clubs are closed. Factory canteens may be open. Guests need to wear face masks indoors but not outdoors on the terraces. Indoor facilities may be visited only by guests who show their immunity certificates. Restaurant, café, and bar workers need to wear face masks indoors and outdoors. Hotels can only receive guests travelling for business purposes, and tourists who have immunity certificates.  Starting May 1, leisure facilities, including museums, theatres, gyms, swimming pools, cinemas and zoos, will be open for visitors with immunity certificates who can take along underaged family members.    https://archive.vn/8e0IL

All events are banned. Sports matches may only take place in empty stadiums. Outdoor amateur team sports are prohibited. Individual sports activities are permitted. No more than 10 people can attend a family gathering or private event. Minors under 14 are exceptions from this limitation. Funerals can be attended by up to 50 people at a time. At weddings only the witnesses, parents and siblings may attend the ceremony and receptions are banned.    https://archive.vn/8e0IL

As of May 1 curfew starts from 12 a.m. to 5 a.m. everybody is required to stay indoors, whether at home, at a temporary home, or an accommodation.  The only exceptions are for commuting to and from work, and in case of health needs or health emergencies.   General rule is that physical distancing of one and a half meters is to be kept, and face masks – only medical and textile masks that cover the nose and mouth are accepted – are mandatory indoor and outdoor. The regulation applies to everybody, with the exception of children under six. Those who breach the rule will be fined or excluded from travel. In cases of resistance, police can be summoned.    https://archive.vn/8e0IL
There are no restrictions on internal movement in Hungary.     https://archive.vn/8e0IL

As a general rule, only Hungarian citizens and their relatives can enter Hungary.  Beginning on September 1, the GOH instituted a COVID-19 entry control scheme, which bans the entry of most foreigners. The decree does not apply to diplomatic or official travel, freight travel, or to anyone who can demonstrate a COVID infection in the last six months.  This restriction is in effect until rescinded by the GOH.  All those entering Hungary are subject to a mandatory 10-day quarantine.  Treatment similar to a Hungarian citizen is granted to family members of Hungarians, those with residency status, sports competitors, and cultural event participants.  There are additional exceptions for military convoys, business purposes, cross border workers, sporting events, and for those transiting Hungary along designated corridors.  Additionally, a special exception can be requested through the Hungarian national police.  A 10-day quarantine is currently required for all international arrivals. Travelers may be exempted from such quarantine if they attest with a document containing the results of two SARS-CoV-2 tests (molecular biology examination in compliance with professional medical practice) performed in Hungary at two different times with at least 48 hours between them that the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus was not detected in their body at the time of the tests. However, it is also acceptable if the first of the two tests is performed in one of the Schengen countries, the United States of America or Canada.   Health screening procedures are in place at airports and other ports of entry      https://archive.vn/8e0IL

On April 23, the state-owned development bank MFB launched a HUF 1,490bn package of financial support instruments for companies, consisting of three loan products, two guarantee instruments and four capital programs.  On May 7, the government announced it will purchase up to HUF 150 billion (0.3 percent of GDP) of bonds issued by banks in order to support lending during the crisis and to ensure financial stability. On May 20, the government announced a new wage subsidy program for new hires, with the condition for a company of keeping a worker for at least nine months. Interest-free loans to SMEs will be available from June 12. Half of the program’s budget will be available for investments, while the other 50 percent is intended to finance liquidity and operations. The highest amount available for investments is HUF 150 million, while asset and liquidity financing loans are capped at HUF 300 million. On August 25th, the government announced that it will not be expanding the wage subsidy scheme for all as of end-August, but only for most affected sector till June 2021. Will March 22, wage subsidies and tax relief available to the hospitality sector will be extended to all sectors subject to the new lockdown.   Measures were also taken to provide financial relief to households and corporates borrowers, including: (i) the provision of a grace period of repayment of loans to the Growth Funding Facility (subsidized lending to SMEs supported by the MNB); (ii) the extension of short-term loans to businesses until June 30; (iii) a repayment moratorium on all existing loans, corporate and retail, until the end of this year, with a reprofiling of debt payment thereafter to avoid an increase in monthly payments; and, (iv) a cap on the average annual percentage rate (APR) on new unsecured consumer credit at the central bank base rate (currently, 0.9 percent) plus 5 percent. On September 20, the government extended debt repayment moratorium by six months for select groups.     https://archive.vn/e1v59

The vaccine will be provided free of charge. It is possible to enter Hungary by road, rail and waterway from all the countries neighbouring Hungary (Croatia, Austria, Romania, Serbia, Slovakia, Slovenia and Ukraine) without any epidemiological restrictions, regardless of your nationality and coronavirus immunity.    Foreign nationals may also enter Hungary without any epidemiological restrictions if they hold a negative PCR test conducted in the previous 72 hours in one of the following places: all EU member states and candidate countries; all OECD member states; all NATO member states, member states of the Turkic Council and Bahrain, China, Georgia, India, Indonesia, Russia; Singapore, Ukraine, and the UAE.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210831090347/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/hungary/entry-requirements
